intro: Viguiera ramosissima, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges. It produces clusters of purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Viguiera ramosissima is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
